title: Israel and Gulf States Advancing Historic ‘Non-Aggression’ Pact
text:
The Times of Israel reports: Israel is reportedly negotiating with several Gulf states on a “non-aggression pact” between them as they face off against an increasingly emboldened Iran.

The deal, which Channel 12 news described as potentially “historic,” aims to put an end to the state of conflict between the Gulf states and Israel, and reportedly provides for friendly relations, cooperation in a variety of fields, and no war or incitement against each other.

Advancing the Israeli initiative, Foreign Minister Israel Katz met on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly last month with several foreign ministers from Arab Gulf states, Channel 12 news reported Saturday night. There was no immediate comment from the Foreign Ministry.

Read more here.
description: Israel is reportedly negotiating with several Gulf states on a “non-aggression pact” between them as they face off against Iran.
